markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Armor 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Chain Mail](/Armor.aspx?ID=46)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Flexible" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=204" />
<trait label="Noisy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=205" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 273 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 6 gp

**AC Bonus** +4

**Dex Cap** +1

**Check Penalty** -2

**Speed Penalty** -5 ft.
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Strength** +3

**Bulk** 2

**Category** Medium

**Group** Chain
</row>

</column>

---

A suit of chain mail consists of several pieces of armor composed of small metal rings linked together in a protective mesh. It typically includes a chain shirt, leggings, a pair of arms, and a coif, collectively protecting most of the body.

<title level="2">Armor Specialization Effects</title>

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup>

Certain class features can grant you additional benefits with certain armors. This is called an armor specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which armor group your armor belongs to, as listed below. Only medium and heavy armors have armor specialization effects.

[Click here for the full rules on Armor Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=211).

<document level="2" id="armor-group-1" />

<title level="2">Specific Magic Armor</title>
[Holy Chain](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3273)
name: Chain Mail
